    question => string (821) "Are cash flows from operating activities disclosed using either: <ul> <li>Th...
    $value[2]['question']
    Are cash flows from operating activities disclosed using either:
<ul>
    <li>The direct method, disclosing major classes of gross cash receipts or payments; or</li>
    <li>The indirect method, by adjusting profit or loss for the effects of:
        <ul>
            <li>changes during the period in inventories and operating receivables and payable;</li>
            <li>other non-cash items (depreciation, provisions, deferred taxation, unrealised foreign currency gains and losses, and in the consolidated cash flow statement undistributed profits from associates); and</li>
            <li>all other items for which the cash effects are investing or financing.</li>
        </ul>
    </li>
</ul>
<p>NB1: Entities are encouraged to report cash flows from operating activities using the direct method.</p>

    $value[3]['question']
    For cash flows from investing and financing activities are the major classes of gross cash receipts and gross cash payments disclosed separately (unless the transactions are entered into as an agent or are cash receipts and payments for items in which the turnover is quick and maturities are short)?
<p>NB1: Paragraphs 23, 23A and 24 give additional guidance.</p>

    question => string (805) "In relation to changes in liabilities arising from financing activities, be ...
    $value[5]['question']
    In relation to changes in liabilities arising from financing activities, be those cash or non-cash changes, has disclosure been given of the following:
<ul>
    <li>Changes from financing cash flows;</li>
    <li>Changes arising from obtaining or losing control of subsidiaries or other businesses; </li>
    <li>The effect of changes in foreign exchange rates;</li>
    <li>Changes in fair values; and</li>
    <li>Other changes?</li>
</ul>
<p><i>NB1: The disclosure of changes in liabilities arising from financing activities must be shown separately from changes in other assets and liabilities.</i></p>
<p><i>NB2: On first time adoption of this requirement, comparatives are not required.</i></p>
<p><i>See IAS 7.44D for a suggested method of fulfilling this disclosure requirement. </i></p>

    question => string (441) "For cash flows from interest and dividends, are the following disclosed: <ul...
    $value[9]['question']
    For cash flows from interest and dividends, are the following disclosed:
<ul>
    <li>Interest received;</li>
    <li>Interest paid;</li>
    <li>Dividends received; and</li>
    <li>Dividends paid?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB1: These items may be allocated to operating, investing or financing activities, see IAS 7, paragraphs 33 and 34.</p>
<p>NB2: Interest paid should include all interest, including interest that has been capitalised.</p>

    ⇄⧉
    question => string (898) "Are aggregate cash flows in respect of both obtaining or losing control of s...
    $value[11]['question']
    Are aggregate cash flows in respect of both obtaining or losing control of subsidiaries or other business during the period disclosed for the following:
<ol type="a">
    <li>the total consideration paid or received;</li>
    <li>the portion of the consideration consisting of cash and cash equivalents;</li>
    <li>the amount of cash and cash equivalents in the subsidiary or other businesses over which control was obtained or lost; and</li>
    <li>the amount of the assets and liabilities other than cash or cash equivalents in the subsidiary or others businesses over which control was obtained or lost, summarised by each major category?</li>
</ol>
<p>NB1:  An investment entity, as defined by IFRS 10 need not disclose the information required by points c and d above regarding any investment in a subsidiary that is required to be measured at fair value through profit and loss.</p>

    $value[14]['question']
    IAS 7 <b><u>encourages</u></b> the disclosure of additional information that is relevant to understand the financial position and liquidity of the entity.  Such disclosures include: 
<ul>
    <li>the amount of undrawn borrowing facilities that may be available for further operating activities and to settle capital commitments, indicating any restrictions on the use of these facilities; and</li>
    <li>the aggregated amount of cash flows that represent increases in operating capacity, separately from those that are required to maintain operating capacity.</li>
</ul>

    In relation to discontinued operations, are the following net cash flows disclosed (either in notes to, or on the face of the Statement of Cash Flows):

    <li>Operating activities;</li>
    <li>Investing activities; and</li>
    <li>Financing activities?</li>
</ul>
<p>NB: These disclosures are not required for disposal groups that are newly acquired subsidiaries that meet the criteria to be classified as held for sale on acquisition.</p>
